verbs.description: sf da gascón to [V: use] [ARG1: 2 m macarthur grant] [ARG2: in bid to thin out jails] the san francisco district attorney office received a 2 million grant from the macarthur foundation that it will use in a bid to reduce the city inmate population and wipe out a looming need for a new city jail over the next two years officials said tuesday district attorney george gascón outlined a plan in which his office will collaborate with experts and other criminal justice agencies to expedite cases analyze outcomes and reduce recidivism a focus of the reforms gascón said will be inmates whose repeated troubles trace to mental illness and addiction the goal is to reduce the jail population superior court reporter evan sernoffsky oregon director tara anderson san francisco george gascón analyst macarthur san francisco bay area bay area neighborhood services committee john d and catherine t macarthur foundation philadelphia policy analyst board of supervisors public safety san francisco chronicle macarthur foundation board of supervisors hall of justice
